abstract_summ: We conducted a systematic review and meta-analysis to assess the clinical efficacy of high-flow nasal cannula (HFNC) therapy as apneic oxygenation in critically ill patients who require endotracheal intubation in the intensive care unit (ICU) We found that HFNC was noninferior to standard of care for oxygen delivery during intubating . The beneficial effect of HFNC in reducing the incidence of severe hypoxemia was observed in patients with mild hypoxemic .
